perturbation.original_text: Company shall ensure that all uses of the name of the NFLA comply with applicable law.
perturbation.changed_text: Company shall endeavor to ensure that uses of the name of the NFLA comply with applicable law.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall ensure' to 'shall endeavor to ensure' weakens the obligation to comply with applicable law, introducing ambiguity. This is because 'endeavor' implies an attempt rather than a guarantee of compliance, potentially conflicting with advertising standards and consumer protection laws that require truthful and non-misleading advertising.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California False Advertising Law (Cal Bus & Prof Code ยง 17500)

perturbation.original_text: Company agrees that it will continue in good-faith to produce and market Licensed Products in the same manner that it is currently producing and marketing such items as of September 2017, unless Company and the NFLA/NFLA-NC believe it is not commercially reasonable to continue to produce and market the Licensed Products.
perturbation.changed_text: Company agrees that it will make reasonable efforts to continue to produce and market Licensed Products in a manner it deems appropriate, unless circumstances suggest otherwise.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'continue in good-faith to produce and market Licensed Products in the same manner that it is currently producing and marketing such items as of September 2017' with 'make reasonable efforts to continue to produce and market Licensed Products in a manner it deems appropriate' introduces ambiguity regarding the standard of production and marketing. The original clause, while containing a subjective 'commercially reasonable' escape clause, at least anchored the standard to the September 2017 practices. Now, 'reasonable efforts' and 'deems appropriate' provide very little concrete guidance. This contradicts the implied warranty of merchantability, which requires that goods be fit for their ordinary purpose, and could conflict with consumer protection laws if the product quality declines significantly.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Commercial Code ยง2314 - Implied Warranty: Merchantability; Usage of Trade

perturbation.original_text: Company agrees to protect, indemnify and hold harmless the NFLA / NFLA-NC and their authorized agents, or any of them, from and against any and all expenses, damages, claims, suits, actions, judgments and costs whatsoever, including reasonable attorney's fees, arising out of, or in any way connected with, actions or omissions of Company, any advertising material furnished by, or an behalf of, Company, or any claim or action for personal injury, death or other cause of action involving alleged defects in Company's Products or services.
perturbation.changed_text: Company agrees to consider protecting, indemnifying, and holding harmless the NFLA/NFLA-NC and their authorized agents from certain expenses, damages, claims, suits, actions, judgments, and costs. The specifics of this protection will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'agrees to protect, indemnify and hold harmless' to 'agrees to consider protecting, indemnifying, and holding harmless' and adding that the specifics will be evaluated 'on a case-by-case basis', the obligation to indemnify is significantly weakened and made ambiguous. This contradicts the purpose of an indemnification clause, which is to provide a clear and enforceable guarantee of protection against specific liabilities, potentially violating basic contract law principles regarding the enforceability of agreements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Civil Code ยง1644 - Interpretation of contracts
